California decreta el estado de emergencia por la gripe aviar tras la confirmaci√≥n de un paciente grave en Luisiana
por
Barney_77
a
elpais.com
____
publicado:
____
El gobernador de California, Gavin Newsom, ha decretado este mi√©rcoles el estado de emergencia despu√©s de que se confirmara el caso grave de gripe aviar en un paciente ingresado en un hospital de Luisiana. Es el primer caso con s√≠ntomas graves detectado en el pa√≠s. El Departamento de Agricultura federal estima que en California, el Estado m√°s poblado del pa√≠s, hay unas 645 cabezas de ganado infectadas con el virus H5N1, detectado desde agosto pasado. La presencia
de la bacteria
del virus se puede rastrear al mes de marzo.

author: redazione
title: "Papa Francesco ha avuto una crisi respiratoria prolungata". Tempi non brevi per il ritorno in Vaticano. Parolin: "Inutili le speculazioni sulle dimissioni" (S.C.)
text:
‚ÄúLe condizioni del Santo Padre continuano ad essere critiche, pertanto, come spiegato ieri, il Papa non √® fuori pericolo. Questa mattina Papa Francesco ha presentato una crisi respiratoria asmatiforme di entit√† prolungata nel tempo, che ha richiesto anche l‚Äôapplicazione di ossigeno ad alti flussi. Gli esami del sangue odierni hanno inoltre evidenziato una piastrinopenia, associata ad un‚Äôanemia, che ha richiesto la somministrazione di emotrasfusioni. Il Santo Padre continua ad essere vigile e ha trascorso la giornata in poltrona anche se pi√π sofferente rispetto a ieri. Al momento la prognosi √® riservata‚Äù. Questo il bollettino medico diffuso in serata dalla Sala Stampa della Santa Sede. Non si tratta di un annuncio drammatico, ma certo il tono √® diverso da quello tranquillizzante usato ieri nel briefing al Gemelli, dove il Papa √® ricoverato al decimo piano ormai da pi√π di una settimana.
‚ÄúIn una intervista al Corriere della Sera, il cardinale segretario di Stato Pietro Parolin ha intanto smentito seccamente le voci sulle possibili dimissioni di Papa Francesco. ‚ÄúMi sembrano ‚Äì ha detto ‚Äì tutte inutili speculazioni. Ora stiamo pensando alla salute del Santo Padre, alla sua ripresa, al suo ritorno in Vaticano: queste sono le uniche cose che contano‚Äù.
Quanto alla diffusione di notizie false e all‚Äôaleggiare di corvi intorno al Vaticano, il porporato ha commentato: ‚ÄúSinceramente, devo dire che non conosco se ci sono manovre del genere e cerco, in ogni caso, di restarne fuori. D‚Äôaltra parte, penso sia abbastanza normale che in queste situazioni si possano diffondere voci incontrollate o venga pronunciato qualche commento fuori luogo: non √® certo la prima volta che accade. Non credo per√≤ che ci sia alcun movimento particolare, e finora non ho sentito niente del genere‚Äù.
Vatican News ha fatto sapere inoltre che il cardinale Parolin, tornato pochi giorni fa dal Burkina Faso, ha comunicato al Papa ‚Äì che √® ricoverato al Gemelli da venerd√¨ della scorsa settimana ‚Äì di essere disponibile a incontrarlo in ospedale, se lo ritiene necessario, ‚Äúma finora non c‚Äô√® stato bisogno‚Äù. ‚ÄúAl riguardo ‚Äì ha aggiunto ‚Äì √® meglio che resti protetto e abbia meno visite possibile, per poter riposare e cos√¨ rendere pi√π efficaci le terapie a cui √® sottoposto. Grazie a Dio, le notizie che arrivano dal Gemelli sono incoraggianti, si sta riprendendo. Gli sono state mandate delle pratiche d‚Äôufficio e ci√≤ significa che procede bene‚Äù.
Da parte sua, il prefetto del Dicastero per la Dottrina della Fede, il cardinale V√≠ctor Manuel Fern√°ndez, intervistato dal quotidiano argentino La Naci√≥n, afferma che ‚Äúnon ha senso che alcuni gruppi facciano pressioni per una rinuncia. Lo hanno gi√† fatto diverse volte negli ultimi anni, e questa pu√≤ essere solo una decisione completamente libera del Santo Padre, perch√© sia valida‚Äù. E aggiunge: ‚ÄúNon vedo un clima da preconclave, non vedo parlare di un possibile successore pi√π di quanto si facesse un anno fa, cio√® niente di speciale‚Äù. E conclude: ‚ÄúPer me √® importante che l‚Äôorganismo del Papa ha reagito bene alla terapia attuale‚Äù.
Sante Cavalleri

author: wa.de
title: Besuch von Annabell Pohl an Marburger Elisabethschule / DVAG st√§rkt Chancengleichheit von jungen Frauen
text:
Besuch von Annabell Pohl an Marburger Elisabethschule / DVAG st√§rkt Chancengleichheit von jungen Frauen
Frankfurt (ots) - Frauen sind in MINT-Berufen in der Minderheit: Nur 16,4 Prozent aller Besch√§ftigten in diesem Bereich sind weiblich*. Das Programm "Wir st√§rken M√§dchen - future ready (WSM)" hat es sich zur Aufgabe gemacht, die freie Berufswahl zu unterst√ºtzen und Gleichberechtigung zu f√∂rdern. Es wurde von der Deutschen Kinder- und Jugendstiftung zusammen mit der "Stiftung RTL - Wir helfen Kindern e.
V." initiiert. Auch die Deutsche Verm√∂gensberatung (DVAG), Annabell Pohl und der gemeinn√ºtzige Verein "DVAG hilft e. V." setzen sich daf√ºr ein, M√§dchen und jungen Frauen eine chancengerechte Zukunft zu erm√∂glichen. Mit der gemeinsamen F√∂rderung konnten bereits zum dritten Mal f√ºnf hessische Schulen an "WSM" teilnehmen.
Annabell Pohl besucht Marburger Sch√ºlerinnen zum Projektabschluss
Eine davon: die Marburger Elisabethschule. Dort war Annabell Pohl, Gr√ºndungsmitglied von "DVAG hilft e. V.", am 11. Juni zu Gast. Sie tauschte sich mit den Sch√ºlerinnen aus und informierte sich in einer Pr√§sentation √ºber die Abschlussprojekte der Teilnehmenden. Seit dem Auftakt im Herbst forschten die M√§dchen mit ihren Lehrkr√§ften zur Wasserqualit√§t oder zur Vermeidung von Lebensmittelverschwendung. Annabell Pohl macht sich mit "DVAG hilft e. V." aktiv f√ºr mehr Gleichberechtigung stark. "Wir st√§rken M√§dchen" ist f√ºr sie ein echtes Herzensprojekt: "Ich bin begeistert von den Ergebnissen. Man sieht, dass die Sch√ºlerinnen mit gro√üem Engagement dabei waren. Durch die intensive Projektarbeit wurden viele wichtige Kompetenzen der M√§dchen geschult und ausgebaut. Das hat sie selbstbewusster gemacht und ihnen neue Perspektiven aufgezeigt."
Selbstbewusstsein st√§rken, Interesse an Wissenschaft und Technik f√∂rdern
Die Themen aus den Bereichen Mathematik, Informatik, Naturwissenschaft und Technik (MINT) vermitteln nicht nur tiefere Einblicke als der Schulunterricht, sondern st√§rken auch Kreativit√§t, Zusammenarbeit und kritisches Denken. Anna Br√ºckner, Projektmanagerin bei der Deutschen Kinder- und Jugendstiftung, sagt: "Wir freuen uns, dass wir den Teilnehmerinnen wertvolle Einblicke in den MINT-Bereich bieten konnten und sie dazu ermutigt haben, sich vorurteilsfrei und selbstbestimmt f√ºr einen Beruf zu entscheiden. Dass wir unser Programm auch im neuen Schuljahr dank der Unterst√ºtzung der DVAG wieder an Schulen in Hessen anbieten k√∂nnen, freut uns umso mehr."
√úber die Deutsche Verm√∂gensberatung Gruppe
Rund 8 Millionen Kunden setzen bei den Themen Absicherung, Altersvorsorge und Verm√∂gensaufbau auf die Kompetenz und Erfahrung der Verm√∂gensberaterinnen und Verm√∂gensberater der Deutschen Verm√∂gensberatung Unternehmensgruppe. Die Finanzcoaches helfen ihren Kunden, das Beste aus ihren Finanzen zu machen. Getreu dem Leitsatz "Fr√ºher an Sp√§ter denken" bieten sie in √ºber 5.200 Direktionen und Gesch√§ftsstellen eine branchen√ºbergreifende und individuelle Beratung. Als Deutschlands gr√∂√üte eigenst√§ndige Allfinanzberatung feiert das Familienunternehmen 2025 sein 50-j√§hriges Jubil√§um und richtet dabei den Blick weiterhin in die Zukunft, um innovative und ma√ügeschneiderte L√∂sungen f√ºr Kundinnen und Kunden anzubieten. Mehr Informationen unter: www.dvag.de.
√úber "DVAG hilft e. V. - Menschen brauchen Menschen"
"DVAG hilft e. V." ist ein gemeinn√ºtziger Verein, der es sich zur Aufgabe gemacht hat, die Lebensgrundlagen und -bedingungen in der Gesellschaft nachhaltig zu st√§rken und zu f√∂rdern. Daher unterst√ºtzt er insbesondere Projekte und Organisationen aus den Bereichen Bildung und Entwicklungsf√∂rderung, Forschung und Wissenschaft sowie Natur- und Umweltschutz. Der gemeinn√ºtzige Verein wird ma√ügeblich von der Deutschen Verm√∂gensberatung unterst√ºtzt. Mehr Infos gibt es unter: www. dvag-hilft.org.
√úber "Wir st√§rken M√§dchen"
"Wir st√§rken M√§dchen" ist ein Programm der Deutschen Kinder- und Jugendstiftung mit dem Ziel, M√§dchen darin zu best√§rken, selbstbestimmt und unabh√§ngig von Stereotypen ihren eigenen Weg zu gehen. M√§dchen und junge Frauen sind bis heute in vielen Berufsfeldern unterrepr√§sentiert, obwohl ihre schulischen Leistungen und Abschl√ºsse ihnen alle T√ºren √∂ffnen. Berufswahlprozesse und -entscheidungen sind weiterhin stark vom Geschlecht gepr√§gt. So sind Frauen bis heute in MINT-Berufen unterrepr√§sentiert, die Wahrscheinlichkeit ist geringer, dass sie ein eigenes Unternehmen gr√ºnden, und sie haben weiterhin weniger Chancen auf F√ºhrungspositionen als M√§nner. Mehr Informationen gibt es auf www.wir-staerken-maedchen.deoder via Instagram @wirstaerkenmaedchen.
Pressekontakt:
Deutsche Verm√∂gensberatung AG, Wilhelm-Leuschner-Stra√üe 24, 60329
Frankfurt am Main
Sina Schirach, Tel.: 069 2384-7556; E-Mail: Sina.Schirach@dvag.com
Birgit Rajchart, Tel.: 069 2384-1563; E-Mail:
Birgit.Rajchart@dvag.com
Weiteres Material:
www.presseportal.de

author: Maya Boddie
title: Mark Meadows‚Äô 'unreasonably vague' request for Trump WH records slammed by DOJ: report
text:
Mark Meadows‚Äô 'unreasonably vague' request for Trump WH records slammed by DOJ: report
Gage Skidmore. Frontpage featured
Mark Meadows, who was indicted alongside Donald Trump and 17 others in Fulton County, Georgia over their efforts to subvert the 2020 election last year, is attempting to make his case go away ‚Äî but it's not working for him so far.
According to Politico, the former Trump chief of staff is asking for the National Archives and Department of Justice special counsel Jack Smith hand over "
thousands of records from" from Meadows' Trump White House stint, claiming that the documents "will help disprove" the allegations that he participated in election interference.
"Mr. Meadows is entitled to these documents in preparation of his defense by law and as a matter of fundamental fairness and constitutional due process," Meadows' lawyer John Moran wrote in a letter to the special counsel and National Archivist Colleen Shogan.
READ MORE:
Ex-Meadows aide explains why Trump 'takes out everybody who is loyal to him'
The ex-MAGA staffer's fight reached federal court this week, Politico reports, "amid
resistance from the National Archives, which called Meadows demands 'unreasonably vague,' 'extensive in scope' and largely irrelevant to the racketeering charge he faces in Georgia."
Per the report, Meadows is requesting "virtually every email, text, schedule and written file he produced as White House chief of staff," "his communications with Joe Biden‚Äôs transition team after the November election," "Trump and then-Vice President Mike Pence‚Äôs internal schedules from Election Day to Biden‚Äôs inauguration," and more.
Meadows' requests has contributed to the case's delay.
Per Politico, "The National Archives contended the broad swaths of records could not be reasonably connected to his criminal defense in Georgia since many of them significantly pre-date the alleged crime."
READ MORE:
'Caught me off guard': Experts describe 'aggression' of grand jury that indicted Trump allies Writing on behalf of National Archives, DOJ lawyer Cassandra Snyder said in a letter, "Your request for ‚Äòany and all records‚Äô and calls that Mr. Meadows and others in his office made or received, spanning a ten-month period, clearly is not pertinent nor relevant to the charged offense."
Politico's full report is available
at this link. Arizona AG officially unveils 9 new felony charges against Trump‚Äôs former chief of staff ‚Ä∫ Trump, Giuliani and Meadows revealed as 'unindicted co-conspirators' in MI investigation ‚Ä∫ Ex-Trump Chief of Staff Mark Meadows‚Äô mugshot released as judge sets bond at $100,000 ‚Ä∫

organizations.name: national archives and department of justice

author: Evan Morgan
title: 'Wheel Of Fortune' Player's Huge Win Stuns Ryan Seacrest
text:
Wheel Of Fortune is, at the end of the day, a game of chance. However, based on recent scenes, one player had luck on their side, and their hefty winning total even shocked host Ryan Seacrest. So, what happened in recent game show scenes, and how much did this player walk away with?
Wheel Of Fortune Is A Game Of Luck While Wheel Of Fortune players may be some of the best puzzle solvers around, an unlucky break can completely change the trajectory of someone‚Äôs game. As longtime fans have seen over the years, one bad wheel spin can completely kill someone‚Äôs momentum, especially if a player lands on the dreaded bankrupt spot on the wheel.
In addition to that, unlucky breaks when it comes to the letters players choose can also mean the difference between walking away with a huge payday or going home with nothing. As Wheel Of Fortune fans see on a regular basis, picking the wrong letters once you get to the big money puzzle at the end is enough to keep someone from solving the puzzle, right at the finish line to boot.
Wheel Of Fortune: Ryan Seacrest Recent Player Had Luck On Their Side In recent scenes, one Wheel Of Fortune player seemed to have all the luck in the world right in his back pocket. Thomas Russo from Scarsdale, New York, was a big winner on a recent episode of the game show. So much so that he even shocked host, Ryan Seacrest.
Following a relatively slow start to his Wheel Of Fortune game, Russo quickly made up for lost time. He won several rounds, and even snagged a trip to the Caribbean in the process. Prior to advancing to the coveted Bonus Round, he had already pocketed more than $17k in cash winnings.
Wheel Of Fortune: Ryan Seacrest Wheel Of Fortune Player Brings It Home In The Bonus Round By the time Russo made it to the final Wheel Of Fortune round, he already built up considerable momentum going into it. Looking at the puzzle in front of him, he selected the letters ‚ÄúH, G, C, and I‚Äù to go with the usual ‚ÄúR, S, T, L, N, and E.‚Äù
All said and done, Thomas Russo was looking at a puzzle like this: ‚Äú_ _ _ I N G / T H _ N G S / H _ _ _ E N.‚Äù
Luckily for him, it did not take Thomas Russo very long to call out: ‚ÄúMAKING THINGS HAPPEN.‚Äù
The shock came a few moments later, when it was revealed that he would be adding an extra $40k to his winning total. All included, he walked away with an impressive $57,100.
For all the latest Wheel Of Fortune and other game show news, come back again to TV Shows Ace for more.

author: Artem Kamenskyi
title: A Vital Role and The Importance Of Rainforests Free Essay Example
text: 24/7 writing help on your phone Save to my list Remove from my list It is a common knowledge about the importance of rainforests and that rainforests play a vital role in the environment. Living creatures greatly benefit from them. For humans, the air they breathe and resources they use, while for animals, it acts as their shelter and home. Rainforests are often called as the lungs of the planet for their role in absorbing carbon dioxide, greenhouse gas, and producing oxygen, upon which all animals depend for survival. According to Christina Nunez, a writer from National Geographic, rainforests are often partly self-watering; plants transpire and the moisture it creates keep the rainforests humid and warm. In fact, it was stated in the study of The Nature Conservancy that even though rainforests only cover less than 2 percent of the Earth‚Äôs surface area, they are home to 50 percent of the planet‚Äôs plants and animals. One of the most known rainforests in the world aside from the Amazon, are the rainforests found in Australia. As stated in the article entitled Australia‚Äôs State of the Forests Report in 2013, Australia has 3.6 million hectares of the rainforest, which contributes to the 3 percent of Australia‚Äôs total native forest area. For many years, their rainforests experience minimal bushfires but only few people are concerned about this matter not until these beautiful greens have been totally burned down, turned into ashes, and took away lives of many plants and animals, even humans. Last September 2019 began the early kickoff to fire season in New South Wales Forest and continued to early 2020. Each year there is a fire season during summer in Australia, with hot and dry weather making it easy for flames to start and spread immediately. Natural causes are to blame most of the time, like lightning strikes in drought affected forests. This time, there has been much debate about who or what to blame with regards to the said bushfire. According to the climate scientist Imran Ahmed, what climate change does is exacerbate the conditions in which the bushfires happen, it is also the fire area‚Äôs temperature since the Australia have just experienced a high record degree of hotness. Meanwhile, Police in New South Wales clarified since November 8, 2019 that a total of 183 people including 40 juveniles have been charged with 205 bushfire-related offenses. 24 across the state have been charged with starting the blazes in the bush, 53 people have had legal actions for allegedly failing to comply with a total fire ban, and 47 people have had legal actions for allegedly discarding a lighted cigarette or match on land . Officials have claimed that the burning will continue for months. Australia has been famous for their tourist spots, well known places such as Victoria, Melbourne, New South Wales, and even Sydney. These are all located in the beautiful continent of Australia that is devastatingly burning as of today. New South Wales have been reported to have 381 homes destroyed in just a span of one week, and more than 1, 500 homes alone this fire season increasing daily, while Victoria and New South Wales together has over 200 fires currently burning. Australia‚Äôs current state brought the hottest, driest year ever recorded. Although some of the states in Australia are not affected by the large bushfire, this has given close cities heavy smoke to be considered hazardous to people‚Äôs health. Sydney has also been experiencing this, that has resulted to the discoloration of the sky that resulted to Sydney‚Äôs hottest temperature on record while Canberra‚Äôs air quality went over 340. It has been reported that more than 25 million acres have been burned, and for us to be able to imagine how large that covers, it could be compared to the whole size of Indiana. These numerous fires has greatly affected one of the most magnificent, mesmerizing and captivating continent of the world but, this does not end within their continent only. These fires brought dangerous smokes to countries nearby, from across the Pacific Ocean to countries such as New Zealand and South America; skies above Chile darkened, and a red sunset from Buenos Aires was witnessed as well. Clair Nullis has also reported that the smoke ‚Äúprobably‚Äù reached the Antarctic. These fires have affected different places already from within and outside the country. Moreover, this has done so many negative impacts to the different aspects of their country, not just economically and environmentally, but also physically and emotionally as it produced many casualties. Building up the structures that have vanished, replacing the millions and billions of fortune that have been burnt along with the trees and acres that stood for a long time and being able to cope up with the lives that has been lost, is not even imaginable right now. Australia happened to be very unfortunate because of the fire. Just as the prime minister of Australia named Scott Morrison have said, 'Until now, the fire won't stop and it will burn for months.‚Äù Furthermore, according to the Ecologists of the University of Sydney, 480 million animals died since September when the fire season started. The firefighters- our brave and strong heroes of the conflagration risked their lives to save people and animals as many as they can, but sadly, there were quite a number of lifeless bodies found all over the place. Despite what happened, this matter has been circling around the Internet and has actually helped in spreading the heartbreaking news to the generous people around the world. With that, many celebrities, philanthropists, and businessmen have donated to Australia, and they raised more than 140 million dollars just to save what is left from the catastrophic incident. The Australian rainforest's bushfire truly made a devastating change in the world. Bushfires are normal phenomenon that happen in different areas surrounded with trees, but this event have brought one of the worst disasters that damaged the lungs of our planet. Until now, different personalities continue to donate huge amounts of money in different charities dedicated to help restore the said rainforest. No one knows what is the real deal on how the fire started to happen, but people should have been more careful on their actions and lifestyle around the area. For instance, people around should be careful on the resources they use that could cause great fire, like throwing lit cigars anywhere or leave behind their lit bonfire after camping, weed control, and many more. Citizens should have been prepared because they are the ones who were near the rainforests. Moreover, there should have been authorities that will guard down or even check the rainforests once in a while to protect the areas. Aside from that, to prevent any further mishaps, people should avoid sharing false information that could trigger the incident. Many lives are at stake that is why this matter should never be taken lightly. The most important part- preparation. Preparation would have made a big change; if only people were more prepared, the destruction could have been lesser. We all know that we cannot change the fact that naturally-occurring disasters are completely normal but we can mitigate and reduce their effects. We, humans, are the stewards of the wonderful world that our Creator has provided for us and the least we can do is to do our part in protecting and preserving the world. It does not matter how big or how small, as long as we contribute to the betterment of our world. A few steps could be a great leap for humanity; a small progress, will always be a progress. Start the change now. üëã Hi! I‚Äôm your smart assistant Amy! Don‚Äôt know where to start? Type your requirements and I‚Äôll connect you to an academic expert within 3 minutes.

author: @ilpost
title: Nell'Agro Pontino molti lavoratori indiani in nero non lavorano pi√π - Il Post
text:
Caricamento player A met√† mattina di luned√¨ 25 novembre nelle strade di Bella Farnia, un piccolo borgo in provincia di Latina abitato da indiani di religione sikh, ci sono pi√π persone del solito. La maggior parte di loro lavora nelle aziende agricole dell‚ÄôAgro Pontino, la pianura che si estende tra Sabaudia e Terracina. A quest‚Äôora i lavoratori indiani solitamente sarebbero stati nei campi a preparare i terreni per le coltivazioni invernali, a sostituire le coperture di plastica delle serre dopo la fine della stagione estiva o a raccogliere kiwi e olive. Le cose sono cambiate come conseguenza della morte di Satnam Singh , il 31enne indiano che mor√¨ lo scorso giugno dopo aver perso un braccio mentre stava lavorando nei campi intorno a Latina. Ora molti degli indiani che lavoravano nell‚ÄôAgro Pontino non hanno pi√π un lavoro.
Alcuni indiani entrano ed escono da un negozio di generi alimentari o da un parrucchiere vicino. Altri sono in un bar che prepara kebab o in un parco con poche panchine e nessun albero. Molti sono in giro con le biciclette che normalmente utilizzavano per andare al lavoro. Qualcuno √® affacciato alla finestra della sua abitazione. ¬´Dopo la morte di Satnam Singh i padroni si sono messi paura e hanno mandato a casa tutti quelli che avevano il permesso di lavoro stagionale scaduto e lavoravano in nero¬ª, spiega il presidente della comunit√† indiana del Lazio Gurmukh Singh (i sikh maschi si chiamano tutti Singh, che vuol dire ¬´leone¬ª, e le donne Kaur, ¬´principessa¬ª: √® un sistema adottato per superare il sistema delle caste, fondato sui cognomi).
(Angelo Mastrandrea/il Post)
Anche Satnam Singh era arrivato in Italia con un permesso di lavoro temporaneo. Quando era scaduto non era ripartito per il Punjab, lo stato indiano da cui proveniva, ma era rimasto a lavorare in nero in un‚Äôazienda di Borgo Santa Maria, la Agrilovato. Il 17 giugno una macchina avvolgi-plastiche gli aveva tagliato un braccio mentre era impegnato nella raccolta dei cocomeri. Secondo le testimonianze di alcuni lavoratori presenti, il proprietario dell‚Äôazienda Alessandro Lovato invece di soccorrerlo lo aveva messo su un furgone e scaricato davanti a casa sua. L‚Äôambulanza era stata chiamata dopo due ore, ma nel frattempo Singh aveva perso molto sangue e due giorni dopo era morto all‚Äôospedale San Camillo di Roma. Lovato √® stato poi indagato per omicidio volontario con dolo eventuale e il processo di primo grado √® ancora in corso al tribunale di Latina.
Il fratello di Satnam Singh, Amritpal (Angelo Mastrandrea/il Post)
Agli inizi di novembre il fratello maggiore di Satnam Singh, Amritpal, √® venuto in Italia per seguire il dibattimento, per ottenere dall‚ÄôInail un risarcimento e il pagamento delle spese per il funerale, che si √® svolto in Punjab. ¬´Non lo vedevo da cinque anni, perch√© ero andato a lavorare come elettricista in Arabia Saudita¬ª, racconta. Quando Satnam √® morto, Amritpal √® tornato in Punjab per assistere la famiglia.
Nelle settimane seguenti i sindacati e la comunit√† indiana hanno organizzato scioperi e proteste, il ministero del Lavoro ha approvato un piano per aumentare le ispezioni nelle 6mila aziende dell‚ÄôAgro Pontino, la pianura a sud di Latina, con l‚Äôobiettivo di verificare i contratti e i permessi di soggiorno: cos√¨ le aziende hanno cominciato a mandare a casa chi non era in regola.
Gurmukh Singh stima che dalla fine dell‚Äôestate almeno il 30 per cento dei lavoratori indiani √® rimasto senza lavoro. ¬´Prima accadeva che li chiamassero anche solo per una giornata, ora non fanno pi√π nemmeno quello, molti ragazzi sono in difficolt√† perch√© non hanno pi√π un salario e vengono da noi per essere aiutati¬ª, racconta. ¬´Se avessimo fatto meno scioperi, forse ora avremmo ancora il lavoro¬ª, dice uno di loro in forma anonima. La comunit√† indiana, che √® abituata ad autorganizzarsi, ha costruito una sorta di welfare informale per sostenere chi ha perso il lavoro, garantendogli cibo e alloggio.
Bella Farnia (Angelo Mastrandrea/il Post)
Nel suo ufficio a Latina, il segretario dell‚ÄôUnione italiana dei lavori agroalimentari (UILA) Giorgio Carra dice di non avere dati precisi su quanti indiani hanno perso il lavoro: sono persone che definisce ¬´invisibili¬ª per le istituzioni, di cui si sa poco o nulla. ¬´Di sicuro per√≤ ci sono migliaia di persone per strada¬ª, dice, come in effetti √® facile notare passando per la zona. Spiega che il fenomeno √® pi√π evidente tra le campagne di Aprilia, Cisterna e Latina, perch√© le aziende di questi comuni non hanno diritto alla cosiddetta ¬´decontribuzione per il sud¬ª, cio√® a un esonero del 30 per cento dei contributi da versare, a differenza di quelle dei comuni dell‚Äôarea pi√π meridionale dell‚ÄôAgro Pontino. La CGIL calcola che gli indiani sfruttati in tutta la provincia di Latina siano tra i 5mila e gli 8mila, ed √® plausibile che gran parte di questi negli ultimi mesi sia rimasta senza lavoro.
Carra spiega che ¬´i sikh arrivano qui con permessi di lavoro stagionale per la raccolta estiva di cocomeri e zucchine, reclutati da intermediari che gli organizzano il viaggio e gli trovano una sistemazione, per questo pagano svariate migliaia di euro, indebitandosi con loro¬ª. Quando il permesso scade per√≤ non hanno i soldi per andare in Punjab e tornare di nuovo l‚Äôestate successiva, ¬´per questo rimangono da irregolari e lavorano in nero nelle stesse aziende¬ª, dice ancora Carra. A suo parere, sarebbe sufficiente che il governo concedesse un permesso di lavoro permanente per ridurre i casi di sfruttamento pi√π estremi e per evitare che l‚Äôaumento dei controlli si ritorca ancora una volta sui lavoratori, che vengono lasciati a casa senza neppure quei 5 euro all‚Äôora che guadagnano in nero. ¬´Finch√© non saranno tutti regolarizzati, il sistema di sfruttamento rimarr√† lo stesso¬ª, conclude Carra.
La piazza di Bella Farnia (Angelo Mastrandrea/il Post)
In tutto l‚ÄôAgro Pontino vivono 13mila indiani con il permesso di soggiorno, ma secondo diverse stime con gli irregolari arriverebbero a 30mila. √à certo che almeno un migliaio di questi abiti a Bella Farnia, ma potrebbero essere anche il doppio, tenendo conto dei migranti senza documenti che non sono censiti. Il ¬´residence¬ª √® un complesso di 400 abitazioni di edilizia povera costruite alla met√† degli anni Settanta per essere vendute come seconde case per le vacanze al mare. Non fu completato perch√© la societ√† immobiliare che lo stava costruendo fall√¨ e le case rimasero abbandonate. Nel 2017 il Tribunale amministrativo del Lazio (TAR) assegn√≤ la gestione al Comune di Sabaudia. Nel frattempo, fu occupato dai sikh provenienti dal Punjab, che lavoravano nelle aziende agricole dell‚ÄôAgro Pontino.
Saman Singh nel suo negozio di alimentari (Angelo Mastrandrea/il Post)
Molti di loro fanno ¬´lavoro grigio¬ª, come si dice in contrapposizione al lavoro in nero: cio√® con contratti solo formalmente regolari, ma con orari e condizioni di lavoro molto differenti da quelli reali. Il 17 ottobre, in quattro aziende agricole la Guardia di Finanza ha trovato 450 lavoratori che lavoravano per un numero di ore molto pi√π alto rispetto a quello stabilito dal contratto, senza riposo settimanale e con una parte della retribuzione pagata in nero, per risparmiare su contributi e tasse. Gurmukh Singh spiega che non sempre la paga ¬´fuori busta¬ª, come viene chiamata, corrisponde a quanto pattuito. ¬´Molti lavoratori aspettano per qualche mese di essere pagati, poi il padrone arriva e gli propone una cifra forfettaria, pi√π bassa, con la scusa che il mercato non va bene e cose del genere¬ª, dice.
I sindacati raccolgono molte segnalazioni e assistono molte persone, ma le denunce scarseggiano perch√© i lavoratori hanno paura. Spesso gli indiani si rivolgono ai capi della comunit√†. Saman Singh, il figlio di Gurmukh, nel suo negozio di generi alimentari raccoglie molte segnalazioni dai suoi connazionali. Dice di aver appena ricevuto una telefonata in cui gli hanno raccontato che un lavoratore ha avuto uno sbalzo di pressione, forse un‚Äôischemia o un ictus, e ¬´il padrone lo ha messo fuori senza avvisare neppure la moglie, che lavora nella stessa azienda¬ª.
In sei mesi, quelli che sono passati dalla morte di Satnam Singh, un solo bracciante ha denunciato il datore di lavoro perch√© non gli versava la cifra pattuita. La questura di Latina per questo gli ha concesso un permesso di lavoro speciale, come anche ai quattro testimoni oculari della morte di Satnam, tra cui la sua compagna Soni, che hanno raccontato ai magistrati cos‚Äôera accaduto. Neppure quest‚Äôincentivo per√≤ √® stato sufficiente a far aumentare le denunce.
¬´Gli indiani spesso hanno paura perfino di essere visti se vanno nella sede di un sindacato o alla questura e di essere giudicati male dalla loro stessa comunit√†¬ª, spiega il sociologo Marco Omizzolo, che da anni lavora sulla comunit√† sikh dell‚ÄôAgro Pontino. Secondo i sindacati, a disincentivare le denunce √® anche il fatto che spesso non hanno alcun esito o si protraggono in indagini che durano anni. Per esemplificare, alla FLAI (Federazione lavoratori dell‚Äôagro-alimentare) CGIL dicono di aver consegnato alla procura di Latina un video in cui due giovani lavoratori indiani mostrano le vessazioni del datore di lavoro, che li costringe a lavorare per 12 ore di fila e poi li chiude con un lucchetto nell‚Äôalloggio in cui riposano. Sostengono che dopo la denuncia tutto √® continuato come prima.
Tag: Bella Farnia - caporalato - latina - satnam singh - sikh agro pontino Mostra i commenti

author: Kate Morton
title: Marquette University: School of Dentistry marks renovation milestone with opening of Delta Dental Urgent and Special Care Clinic
text:
MILWAUKEE ‚Äî Marquette University School of Dentistry celebrated a major milestone in its facility revitalization campaign Tuesday with the grand opening of the Delta Dental Urgent and Special Care Clinic.
A ceremony held Tuesday commemorated the multi-year effort to renovate the school‚Äôs educational clinics and upgrade technology and equipment throughout the 120,000-square-foot -building. The completed renovations better serve patients and create an enhanced clinical education environment to support Wisconsin‚Äôs future oral health care workforce.
‚ÄúIt has been exciting to see the revitalization of these clinics, from conception to construction to completion,‚Äù President Kimo Ah Yun said. ‚ÄúOur students are learning in state-of-the-art facilities with enhanced equipment and technology that will prepare them to successfully and seamlessly begin their careers upon graduation. These new spaces also allow us to continue our long-standing commitment to providing high-quality oral care for our community, especially members of underserved populations.‚Äù
The roughly 2,900-square-foot Delta Dental Urgent and Special Care Clinic ‚Äî formerly the Advanced Care Clinic ‚Äî which serves emergency and special needs patients, underwent one of the most significant transformations in the revitalization. The special care wing includes a private operating room equipped with a wheelchair lift and bariatric chair for people with disabilities, a private sensory adapted room and two new dental chairs. On the other side of the clinic, a lab and a radiology room and four new chairs ‚Äî including one specifically for endodontic care ‚Äî serve those needing urgent care.
As a part of the successful university-wide Time to Rise campaign, the School of Dentistry launched capital fundraising efforts to upgrade the original clinics within the school‚Äôs existing infrastructure. Beginning in 2022, in an effort led by Marquette Trustee Emeritus John Bergstrom and alumna Sue Meinerz, D.D.S., the school raised approximately $7.5 million to rebuild the facility and clinics, with generous support from Delta Dental of Wisconsin, the Wisconsin Dental Association, and gifts from alumni donors and friends of the School of Dentistry. That same year, the school was awarded a $1.02 million grant from the Health Resources and Services Administration of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services to update clinic equipment and increase capacity for the care of patients with special needs. In addition, the State of Wisconsin generously contributed $10.75 million for the overall campaign in August. 2023.
‚ÄúMarquette lives its mission, and I am proud that you can see it in action everyday within the walls of the School of Dentistry,‚Äù said Dr. Elsbeth Kalenderian, dean of the dental school. ‚ÄúWe are incredibly grateful for Delta Dental of Wisconsin, the Wisconsin Dental Association, government leaders and the countless donors who demonstrated their belief in our School of Dentistry students, faculty and staff through their support of this project. Collectively, all our partners understand that by working together, we serve the citizens of Wisconsin with integrity, passion and excellence, particularly our underserved and special needs patients, which embodies our mission.‚Äù
The school‚Äôs revitalization project has taken place in three phases since 2022: Phase one included renovating two pre-doctoral clinics and marked the beginning of construction on the Dr. Patrick Pralle Innovation Center; phase two included renovating the two remaining pre-doctoral clinics; phase three will finish with upgrading the school‚Äôs seven specialty clinics, six classrooms and patient areas.
As the state‚Äôs only dental school, Marquette delivers patient care and services to citizens from 66 of Wisconsin‚Äôs 72 counties. Since its state-of-the-art building opened in 2002, the School of Dentistry has received nearly 2 million patient visits, with an estimated value of services provided annually exceeding $16 million. By offering the most advanced clinical resources and instructional technology available, the next Marquette dental students are positioned to grow and adapt with the rapidly changing health care landscape.
About Marquette University School of Dentistry
Founded in 1894, Marquette University School of Dentistry has been a significant provider of oral health care to patients and excellent clinically based dental education to dental students and recently celebrated 130 years of providing dental education and community service. Programs are guided by dedicated faculty and practicing professionals who uphold Marquette‚Äôs vision to train highly skilled oral health care practitioners to bring top-quality dental care to urban and rural communities across the country and around the world.
